UNANIMOUS SHAREHOLDERS AGREEMENT

THIS AGREEMENT made March 1, 2019

AMONG:

DAVID KUMAR, of Vancouver, BC
JENNIFER TAM, of Burnaby, BC
MARCUS WILLIAMS, of Surrey, BC

(collectively the "Shareholders")

AND:

INNOVATE TECH SOLUTIONS INC., a company incorporated under the Business Corporations Act (British Columbia)
(the "Company")

RECITALS:

A. The Company was incorporated on March 1, 2019, to carry on business as a software development company.

B. Each Shareholder has subscribed for 100 common shares of the Company (33.33% each).

C. Each Shareholder has contributed $50,000 as initial capital.

D. The Shareholders wish to set out their rights and obligations regarding the Company.

AGREEMENT:

1. SHARE OWNERSHIP

1.1 The authorized and issued share capital is:
    - David Kumar: 100 common shares
    - Jennifer Tam: 100 common shares
    - Marcus Williams: 100 common shares
    - Total: 300 common shares

2. MANAGEMENT AND VOTING

2.1 The following matters require unanimous shareholder approval:
    a) Issuance of new shares
    b) Amendment of Articles
    c) Sale of substantially all assets
    d) Merger or amalgamation
    e) Winding up or dissolution
    f) Borrowing exceeding $100,000
    g) Capital expenditures exceeding $50,000

2.2 All other matters shall be decided by majority vote (66.67%).

3. BOARD OF DIRECTORS

3.1 The Board shall consist of three directors, one nominated by each Shareholder:
    - David Kumar (or his nominee)
    - Jennifer Tam (or her nominee)
    - Marcus Williams (or his nominee)

3.2 Board decisions require a majority vote (two directors).

4. EMPLOYMENT AND COMPENSATION

4.1 The Shareholders shall be employed by the Company in the following capacities:
    - David Kumar: Chief Technology Officer
    - Jennifer Tam: Chief Executive Officer
    - Marcus Williams: Chief Financial Officer

4.2 Initial salaries shall be $60,000 per year for each Shareholder/officer.

4.3 Salary increases require unanimous Board approval.

4.4 Termination of a Shareholder's employment does not affect their share ownership.

5. DIVIDENDS

5.1 The Company shall distribute at least 50% of annual net profits as dividends to Shareholders pro rata.

5.2 Dividend declarations require majority Board approval.

6. INFORMATION RIGHTS

6.1 Each Shareholder is entitled to:
    a) Annual audited financial statements
    b) Quarterly unaudited financial statements
    c) Monthly management reports
    d) Access to corporate books and records upon reasonable notice

7. TRANSFER RESTRICTIONS

7.1 No Shareholder may transfer shares without complying with this Agreement.

7.2 RIGHT OF FIRST REFUSAL: If a Shareholder wishes to sell shares, they must first offer them to the other Shareholders on the same terms.

7.3 The offering Shareholder must provide written notice including the price and terms.

7.4 The other Shareholders have 30 days to accept the offer pro rata to their shareholdings.

8. SHOTGUN PROVISION

8.1 Any Shareholder may trigger the "shotgun" provision by offering to buy all shares of another Shareholder at a specified price per share.

8.2 The receiving Shareholder must either:
    a) Sell their shares at the offered price; OR
    b) Buy the offering Shareholder's shares at the same price per share.

8.3 The receiving Shareholder has 30 days to elect their option.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

9.1 Any dispute under this Agreement shall first be submitted to mediation.

9.2 If mediation fails within 60 days, the dispute may be submitted to arbitration or court proceedings.

10. DEADLOCK

10.1 If the Shareholders reach a deadlock on a matter requiring unanimous approval, any Shareholder may invoke the shotgun provision.

11. TERMINATION OF SHAREHOLDER EMPLOYMENT

11.1 If a Shareholder's employment is terminated for cause, the other Shareholders may require them to sell their shares at fair value (determined by independent valuator).

11.2 If a Shareholder's employment is terminated without cause, they retain all shareholder rights including the right to remain as a shareholder and director.

12. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-COMPETITION

12.1 Each Shareholder agrees to maintain confidentiality of Company information.

12.2 While a shareholder and for 12 months after ceasing to be a shareholder, each Shareholder agrees not to compete with the Company's business.

13. GENERAL

13.1 This Agreement is governed by the laws of British Columbia.

13.2 This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the parties.

13.3 Amendments require unanimous written consent.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties have executed this Agreement.

_________________________      _________________________
David Kumar                    Jennifer Tam
Date: March 1, 2019           Date: March 1, 2019

_________________________
Marcus Williams
Date: March 1, 2019

INNOVATE TECH SOLUTIONS INC.

Per: _________________________
     Jennifer Tam, Director
     Date: March 1, 2019
